meanings.definition: Reluctant to spend money or resources
meanings.sent1: She was so miserly that she refused to buy anything that wasn't absolutely necessary.
meanings.sent2: His miserly habits meant he never treated himself to anything special.
meanings.sent3: The miserly old man wouldn't even spare a penny for charity.
meanings.sent4: Her miserly attitude towards spending was like a locked vault, never to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The miserly character in the story hoarded every penny, even in times of need.

meanings.sent1: The miserly landlord refused to fix anything in the apartment unless forced to.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her miserly ways, always looking for discounts and never tipping.
meanings.sent3: The miserly uncle would count every penny before lending money to family.
meanings.sent4: His miserly grip on the purse strings was tighter than a knot.
meanings.sent5: The miserly businessman would rather lose a friend than a dollar.

meanings.sent1: The miserly boss never praised his employees, no matter how hard they worked.
meanings.sent2: Her miserly nature was evident in the way she never shared her snacks with others.
meanings.sent3: The miserly character in the play refused to share the spotlight with anyone else.
meanings.sent4: His miserly heart was as cold as a block of ice, never giving an inch.
meanings.sent5: The miserly queen taxed her subjects heavily, leaving them with barely enough to survive.
